alert.note: Alert for Dubois; Orange (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 7:14AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Indiana, including the following counties, Dubois and Orange. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 714 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jasper, Paoli, Huntingburg, Orleans, French Lick, Stampers Creek, Orangeville, West Baden Springs, Cuzco and Norton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
